text: hey all, I've been working on a module to contribute which will ease the boilerplate involved in writing chaincode and was told to coordinate with the folks in this channel, but I was warned that you were all working hard on the v1 release -- has that been completed yet?
<@U1ES70KQS> `has that been completed yet` - if you mean has v1 release has been completed ? No….
mm
Would it be better for me to wait until you're less busy with v1 or can I try to submit the module now? (I also have some questions regarding the submission process)
<@U1ES70KQS>  you mean as  gerritt CR ?
yeah

I'd submitted via gerritt already but took too long to make the changes they wanted and now that change-set has been abandoned. I was going to resubmit and wondered if I should remove the sign-off tag in the commit message and resign it to get a new changeset ID?
I was also wondering if I should do a usage tutorial and where that should go in the repo
<@U0P1VU0QG|ikruiper> has joined the channel

<@U1ES70KQS> If the changes are intrusive to fabric packages (as opposed to examples or tooling) it may be worthwhile waiting for the dust to settle down. (In a similar vein a “ccchecker” tooling was recently submitted into examples rather than into fabric)
not because it will be disruptive to the fabric … but just because it might take longer to review and may cause rebase issues for you
I've put my module in core/chaincode/shim/ -- another question I had was whether this would be the best place for it
but it really is upto you
ok
one thing
would this affect just go or java chaincodes too ?
just go
ok

It's pretty-much stand-alone and doesn't affect other code. I've had to change the example code as things have evolved but the only changes I've made the module itself were a couple bug-fixes and some features
well there will be other changes to chaincode too - the big one is <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1457>
that JIRA is being worked thru and could impact dependent code
ah, now that _would_ affect my module
right , that’s kind of what I meant with “waiting for dust to settle down”
(also, did they completely remove the Query interface?)
yeah, best to wait then
is there an estimated release date?
(& thinks for linking me to that JIRA, btw)
sure thing… the Query interace is gone from chaincode, yes
as all chaincode requests come as “Proposals” for endorsement the distinction was removed in favor of a simpler model
hmm
so if you look at chaincode_example02, you can see how the old “query” inteface was turned into another invoke
and if you look at CLI, it still supports `peer chaincode query…` except that it does not submit the response as a tx
I had noticed that in example02
<@U0ULK2JPP> thanks for your help!
